# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line = length(current_line) == 0 ? word : current_line * " " * word
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
text = "This is a sample text that needs to be wrapped."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function splits the input text into words, then iterates over the words to build lines that do not exceed the specified `text_width`. If adding a word would exceed the `text_width`, it starts a new line. Finally, it joins the lines with newline characters and returns the wrapped text.
